title: Watch: India finally releases Chinese spy pigeon who did nothing wrong, after holding the "prisoner" for eight months
description:
There is a satirical conspiracy theory that suggests birds are not real and are actually drones used by the government to spy on citizens. But India’s government may have taken that conspiracy theory, which is a joke that no one believes, very seriously. It appears they have interrogated and detained an innocent pigeon whom they wrongfully suspected of espionage for eight months.

Fortunately, the bird has finally been cleared of all wrongdoing and has been released back to the sky after it was confirmed he was not planning a coo.

— (@)

But this does not sit well with me. First of all, why would they not just euthanize the bird if that

title: Watch: Joe Biden AGAIN lies to family of fallen service member that his son died in Iraq (Spoiler: "G.I. Beau" did not)
description:
Editor's Note: Totally biting "G.I. Beau" off of Tim Graham from Newsbusters, because it's hilarious.

Biden finally found enough effort to make a phone call with the parents of one of the three soldiers killed in a drone strike last week. But rather than give his genuine condolences to the grieving family, he decided it was easier to once again, repeat his false claim that his son Beau died in Iraq.

— (@)

title: Someone the LA Times DIDN'T lay off wants you to believe throwing soup at the Mona Lisa helps fight climate change
description:
The Los Angeles Times just laid off 20 percent of its workforce. And it’s because they publish asinine stories that are so astonishing, you wouldn’t even believe The Babylon Bee would publish it.

The publication just published a very serious article about why throwing soup at the Mona Lisa actually can help fight
